task.title: Run the Extended Pipeline
task.shortdesc: Now that the extended pipeline is complete, let's reset the origin and run the pipeline again.

context.p: Reset the origin when you want to process all available data instead of processing data from the last-saved offset. Not all origins can be reset, but you can reset the origin for Directory.

step.cmd: In the UI menu bar, click the More icon: . Then, click Reset Origin.
When the confirmation dialog box displays, click Yes, then close the dialog box.
To start the pipeline, click the Start icon.

taskbody.result:
goes into Monitor mode and the data alert triggers again. Before long, you'll see some error records in the Jython Evaluator and the Field Type Converter.
For each stage, you can see the error messages for latest error records.
To look at all the error records, you can review the error record files in the directory that you specified. Error records are written in the SDC Record data format so you can create an error pipeline to process error records. We'll show you how to create an error pipeline to process these error records in a future tutorial.
That's it for this tutorial. Hope you found it helpful!
